---
title: "trisurf"
---

```
trisurf(in, kw...)
```

Plots the 3-D triangular surface.

The triangulation is defined by the points in a Mx3 matrix or a GMTdataset with data  x, y, z in the 3 first columns.
The triangles are computed with a Delaunay triangulation done internaly. Since this is a `plot3d` *avatar*
all options in this function are those of the `plot3d` program.

### Example

Create a set of 3-D points and plot the surface defined by the triangulation.

```{julia}
using GMT

x,y,z = peaks(N=45, grid=false);
trisurf([x[:] y[:] z[:]], pen=0.5, show=true)
```

```
trisurf(G, G2=nothing; bottom=false, downsample=0, isbase=false, ratio=0.01,
        thickness=0.0, wall_only=false, top_only=false, geog=false, kw...)
```

Short form for the sequence $D = grid2tri(...)$ followed by $viz(D)$. See the documentation of $grid2tri$ for more details.
